It cannot be raised, and resurrection works only if it is willing. It has darkvision out to 60 feet. PSEUDONATURAL CREATURE Past the timeless eons that lie between the stars, pseudonatural creatures dwell beyond the planes as we know them, nestled in far realms of insanity. When summoned to the Material Plane, they often take on the form and abilities of familiar creatures, though they are more gruesome in appearance than their earthly counterparts. Alternatively, they might appear in a manner more consis- tent with their origins, manifesting as masses of writhing tentacles or other even more terrible-looking forms. Pseudonatural hippogriff 161 Illus. by D. Crabapple 8 RETPAHC WEN SRETSNOM Combat Spell Resistance (Ex): A pseudonatural creature gains spell A pseudonatural hippogriff dives at its prey and strikes with resistance equal to 10 + the base creature’s HD (maximum 25). its clawed forelegs. When it cannot dive, it slashes with claws Abilities: Same as the base creature, but Intelligence is and beak. at least 3. Alternate Form (Su): As a standard action, a pseudonatural Environment: Any land and underground. hippogriff can take the form of a grotesque, tentacled mass Challenge Rating: Up to 3 HD, as base creature; 4 (though this alien appearance has no effect on the creature’s abili- HD to 11 HD, as base creature +1; 12 or more HD, as base ties). Other creatures receive a –1 morale penalty on their attack creature +2. rolls against the creature when it is in this alternate form.
